title: How to Make a Simple Bead Bracelet

steps.headline: Thread the beads onto the cord in any order you like.
steps.description: Leave the cord on the roll at this stage so your beads don't drop off.

steps.headline: When you think you have enough beads on the cord, try the bracelet around your wrist for size.
steps.description: When you are happy, cut the cord, giving you plenty of length at each end to tie a knot.

steps.headline: Tie the ends in a double or triple knot.
steps.description: Put a dab of PVA glue on the knot and leave it to dry.

steps.headline: Trim the ends of the cord when the glue has dried.
steps.description: Close the knot, and there you have it- your very own bracelet.

text: Thread the beads onto the cord in any order you like. Leave the cord on the roll at this stage so your beads don't drop off. When you think you have enough beads on the cord, try the bracelet around your wrist for size. When you are happy, cut the cord, giving you plenty of length at each end to tie a knot. Tie the ends in a double or triple knot. Put a dab of PVA glue on the knot and leave it to dry. Trim the ends of the cord when the glue has dried. Close the knot, and there you have it- your very own bracelet.
